{{Description|In the countryside of [[Fontaine]], [[Ulman]] is planning the future of his business enterprise...}}
'''Lost Riches''' is an [[Event]] in [[Version 4.3]].

==Event Details==
===Duration===
* 2024/01/02 10:00 - 2024/01/15 03:59

===Requirements===
* [[Adventure Rank]] 20 or above
* Unlock any [[Statue of The Seven]] in [[Fontaine]]

===Summary===
* During the event, check the treasure map within Ulman's Treasure Book. Follow the map to reach the area where the treasure is buried. Ulman will mark out one new area in this book each day, for a total of 6 treasure areas.
* Help the [[Treasure-Seeking Seelie]] absorb energy in various ways in the treasure area to help it restore vitality. For every 3 instances of elemental energy obtained, the Treasure-Seeking Seelie will indicate the whereabouts of the treasure once.
* Dig in a treasure area to find the treasure chest and claim the "[[Ancient Iron Coin]]s" within.
* During the event, you can exchange "Ancient Iron Coins" for materials in the Event Shop. After the event ends, your remaining "Ancient Iron Coins" will disappear.
* Upon completing Area 6, the Event Shop will open for the redemption of "[[Mini Seelie: Brilliance]]," "[[Mini Seelie: Moss]]," "[[Mini Seelie: Viola]]," "[[Mini Seelie: Dayflower]]," "[[Mini Seelie: Rosé]]," and "[[Mini Seelie: Curcuma]]." During this event, Travelers may only exchange for one type, after which the remaining five will no longer be available. Each [[Mini Seelie]] can only be obtained once.

===Tutorial===
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 1.png
|text1  = Check the treasure map within Ulman's Treasure Book and follow the map to reach the area where the treasure is buried. Ulman will mark 1 new area in this book every day and will mark a total of 6 different treasure areas.
|image2 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 2.png
|text2  = If you equip the Treasure-Seeking Seelie from your Inventory, you can summon it when in a treasure area. However, if you are not in a treasure area, the Treasure-Seeking Seelie may not answer your summons.
|image3 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 3.png
|text3  = After you equip and summon the Treasure-Seeking Seelie, the minimap will mark the location of energy emissions. Go to these areas and help the Treasure-Seeking Seelie collect energy to revitalize it. It will be able to find one treasure location after collecting energy 3 times.
|image4 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 4.png
|text4  = Once you begin searching a treasure area on land, the Treasure-Seeking Seelie will start searching for treasure within a certain radius. You must help this Seelie absorb energy and keep it energetic. Helping it make a full recovery within a certain amount of time allows it to start searching for the treasure's location.
|image5 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 5.png
|text5  = When the Treasure-Seeking Seelie finds the treasure, it will stay there and display the location of the treasure itself. Dig the treasure up and open the chest to obtain various rewards.
}}

;Underwater Challenges
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 Underwater Challenges 1.png
|text1  = When a Mist Bubble obstructs the path of the Treasure-Seeking Seelie to the energy it needs, you must complete a challenge to burst the bubble and remove the obstruction.
|image2 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 Underwater Challenges 2.png
|text2  = During the challenge, you must absorb the abilities of specific Xenochromatic Fontemer Aberrants while having the Treasure-Seeking Seelie with you. Follow the clues to locate the required Xenochromatic Fontemer Aberrants.
|image3 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 Underwater Challenges 3.png
|text3  = Challenges have multiple rounds. Destroy all the Pufferfruit using specific Xenochromatic Fontemer Aberrant abilities or defeat all monsters within the time limit to complete each round. Complete all rounds to complete the challenge.
|image4 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 Underwater Challenges 4.png
|text4  = The Flintyfruit is a Pufferfruit with a hard outer shell. Crack open its shell before destroying the Pufferfruit within.
|image5 = Tutorial Lost Riches 2024-01-02 Underwater Challenges 5.png
|text5  = Hitting a Dirty Fruit will reset all Pufferfruit, Flintyfruit, and Dirty Fruit in the round. Try your best to avoid Dirty Fruit while destroying the Pufferfruit.
}}
